channel.title: Penn Spark Newsletter
channel.description: Updates from Penn's Fav Tech & Design Club <3
channel.itunes:author: Penn Spark
channel.googleplay:author: Penn Spark

item.title: FDAO (First Day of Apps Open)
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Live from Accenture Cafe, we are so back in Philly and hyped for another great semester. Guess what I deployed to our website today at 7am? That’s right:

🏮 RED APPLICATIONS (ARE OPEN NOW)!!!

Due Jan 24 @ 5pm

We are recruiting for Red Developers and Red Designers! As a reminder, our Red track is for members who have prior experience developing or designing and are ready to be added to our project teams and start building with us right away.

Both developer and designer applicants will have to complete a technical assessment. Full instructions are in the application; essentially, we want to learn what your skills are and see what kinds of ideas you come up with when asked to build something.

We are hosting a General Information Session on Jan 22 at 7pm, where our team will be going over our club and application information in more detail. We will also be happy to answer any of your questions. Location will be confirmed and posted to our website soon.

Applications are due Jan 24th at 5pm EST. Please note that our next recruiting cycle for Blue will be Fall 2026.

Application: https://pennspark.org/join/. Follow us on Instagram at @pennspark so you don’t miss any updates, and feel free to reach out to upennspark@gmail.com with any questions!

💕 Your turn

Drop your New Year’s Resolutions:

Leave a comment

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support our work.

Interested in hosting an event, working on a project, or serving as a mentor with us? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Please email me at upennspark@gmail.com and check out our previous work at www.pennspark.org.

Do your apps. Come meet us. See you in my spreadsheet.

With love,

Meiling Mathur

Co-President, Penn Spark 💌

item.title: Sparksgiving Season
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
As always, the end of the semester is fast approaching, bringing with it everything from late midterms to club formals and project deadlines with Thanksgiving travel plans sandwiched somewhere in between. Whether I end up being an academic weapon or an academic victim this semester is something that I’ll find out in a few weeks, but, until then, I’m enjoying spending my weekends and nights with the friends I’m most grateful for, starting with my community at Penn Spark.

🎉 YOU’RE INVITED – Showcase!

Dec 6 @ 5pm in Wu and Chen Auditorium, Levine Hall

We are excited to announce our end-of-semester project showcase on Saturday, December 6th from 5-7pm in Wu and Chen Auditorium! Come check out the projects that our Red teams have been working hard on, as well as preview what our Blue teams are planning to build next semester.

Here are the Red projects we are looking forward to presenting:

Penn Pulse: A web app that lets users upload tracks to be seamlessly mixed into continuous playlists using DSP techniques and AI-driven generative models for more creative, DJ-style sets.

Pent Up: An anonymous confessional platform for Penn students to share unspoken thoughts and experiences, inspired by the Unsent Project.

Public Music Queue: A chaotic, public music queue where anyone can add songs and the community votes to skip tracks in real-time—a fun, collaborative listening experience with democratic elements.

Spark Website Redesign: Our revamped website to reflect our club’s mission of serving as Penn’s pre-professional community of artists, creators, and innovators.

SphereUS: A creator search platform for “the world’s most powerful and comprehensive AI-powered influencer research database for influencer discovery, analytics, reporting, media kit generation, and safety review, and outreach” (sphereus.co).

And the Blue projects we are excited to launch:

Sync’d: An app that allows users to track and complete bucket lists and wishlists with friends.

Franki: An on-campus betting platform for Penn students to bet non-monetary currency on items like sports games, mentions, etc.

Buddify: An app where you share a song every day, week or month (depending on what goal you choose) and maintain a streak with your buddy.

Capsule: An app to help PR teams create shared photo albums for every event and turn them into clean, ready-to-post graphics in one place.

🏈 Homecoming

Thank you to our alumni for coming to our homecoming potluck earlier this month! We loved getting to catch up with them and learn how they are doing now. If you are an alum interested in staying connected with us, we would love to have you join our professional network here:

Join our network

🦃 Spark x Labs x Hack x Upgrade Friendsgiving potluck

We had a blast hosting our Friendsgiving potluck on Sunday with members of Penn Labs, Hack4Impact, and Upgrade! It was really great spending time with everyone before Thanksgiving break, and we are looking forward to hosting more events together next semester.

📌 Spark updates

Three weeks ago, we had the opportunity to host Merit Systems, a company that’s building a platform for developers to monetize their code on the internet, for a workshop on Echo, an SDK for monetizing AI applications. We appreciated the opportunity to learn about their product and how we can use it in our own work going forward.

📈 Spring 2026 applications

Interested in joining us? Our applications for Red developers and designers will be open at the beginning of next semester. Follow us on Instagram at @pennspark to stay updated on deadlines, swing by the SAC fair to meet us in person, and, as always, don’t hesitate to reach out to us at upennspark@gmail.com with any questions.

💕 Your turn

Interested in hosting an event, working on a project, or serving as a mentor with us? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Please email me at upennspark@gmail.com and check out our previous work at www.pennspark.org.

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support our work.

Stay thankful. Enjoy the long weekend. See you at showcase!

With love,

Meiling Mathur

Co-President, Penn Spark 💌

item.title: Over the Penn Spark Wall
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
It is a dark and stormy night, and I’m currently spooked by the fact that we’re over halfway through the semester already. Between the progress we’ve been making on our projects so far and the plans we have lined up for the rest of the semester, I’m personally stoked for the next 6, 7 weeks.

(I’m sorry)

🎉 YOU’RE INVITED – Liminal Spaces

Nov 1 @ 10pm

Who said engineers don’t know how to party? Come to Liminal Spaces, this year’s Halloweekend tech downtown, for a spookily good time with our dev community! We’re excited to host members of Spark, Labs, Upgrade, and Hack.

Tickets are $25 for individuals and $20 for groups of 4+, so bring your friends! RSVP early before ticket prices increase at the door: https://partiful.com/e/INbPItrheNNDvOSrFyAz

There are 10 types of people: those who were at the event, and those who heard about it the day after. Be part of the former. You won’t regret it.

🧁 Bake sale

Oct 29 on Locust

Spark bake sale is BACK! Come find us on Wednesday, October 29th, on Locust for some sweet treats. Fun fact: Blood glucose is a source of energy for self-control in the brain (source), so if you’re looking for an extra boost of willpower to lock in for that upcoming midterm, we’ve got you covered.

🎤 Industry panel

Thank you Monica, Alan, and Joshua from Google, Meta, and Harvard University for taking the time to speak with us at our industry panel today! We enjoyed learning about their experiences navigating the intersections of engineering and design in their work, as well as the importance of staying true to one’s passions while embarking on any career. We’re looking forward to continuing to work with them as mentors and hosting another panel soon.

📌 Spark updates

We had a blast taking our members to the Poconos last weekend for our semesterly club retreat. We’re excited to partner with Playbook, an intuitive and collaborative online platform for sharing visuals across teams, as we continue to build out our projects. We’re also looking forward to hosting Merit Systems next month for a workshop on their products.

💕 Your turn

Interested in hosting an event, working on a project, or serving as a mentor with us? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Please email me at upennspark@gmail.com and check out our previous work at www.pennspark.org.

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and stay updated with us.

Here’s to tricks and treats, friends and foes, and, of course, the Eagles. See you at Liminal Spaces!

With love,

Meiling Mathur

Co-President, Penn Spark 💌

item.title: Spark-tember is in the air
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
WE’RE BACK! I hope the first month of school has been treating everyone well. Those crazy Philly summer temperatures are finally cooling down a bit; I’m so here for the falling leaves and friend reunions on Locust, the recently-opened Molly Tea on Chestnut, and, of course, kicking off Spark’s new year with my cracked exec team and co-president Raphael :)

🎉 Onboarding

We are thrilled to announce our newbie cohort of 16 developers and 10 designers, featuring 8 developers and 8 designers in our Fall 2025 Blue class and 8 developers and 2 designers on our Red project teams. We had a great time getting to know all of them throughout the recruitment process, and we can’t wait to build with them this year!

📌 Projects

We are excited to kick off six projects this semester, including a client project with investor-backed startup SphereUS and a collaboration with the Global NGO Executive Committee (GNEC). Read more about what we’re cooking in all of our projects below:

Penn Pulse: A web app that lets users upload tracks to be seamlessly mixed into continuous playlists using DSP techniques, with future plans to integrate AI-driven generative models for more creative, DJ-style sets.

Pent Up: The Pent Up Project is an anonymous confessional platform for Penn students to share unspoken thoughts and experiences, inspired by the Unsent Project.

Public Music Queue: A chaotic, public music queue where anyone can add songs and the community votes to skip tracks in real-time—a fun, collaborative listening experience with democratic elements.

GNEC Hackathon: The GNEC Hackathon is an initiative created to connect non-governmental organizations (NGOs) in need of technical skills with high school and college students seeking experience. The hackathon encourages youth to develop sustainable technology projects themed around the 17 UN-SDGs, with top participants earning internships at partner NGOs.

Spark Website Redesign: We are looking forward to revamping our current website to reflect our club’s mission of serving as Penn’s pre-professional community of artists, creators, and innovators.

SphereUS: “The world’s most powerful and comprehensive AI-powered influencer research database for influencer discovery, analytics, reporting, media kit generation, and safety review, and outreach” (sphereus.co). We will be working with SphereUS to brainstorm, design, and develop features for their creator search platform.

🎤 Outreach updates

Thank you to our alumni for their generous contributions so far! Interested in supporting us through project mentoring, guest speaking, intern referral, or simply staying in the loop with the Spark community? We’d love to have you join our professional network here!

Join our network

Last Sunday, we welcomed Daniel Tian, co-founder/CTO of Zingage, to speak to our members about his company and open roles. We appreciated the opportunity to learn about his company and what it’s like being part of an early-stage, high-growth startup.

We will be hosting another recruiting event this semester with California-based startup Reevo that will be open to all Penn students – stay tuned at our Instagram @pennspark for more details!

💕 Your turn

Interested in hosting an event, working on a project, or serving as a mentor with us? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Please email me at upennspark@gmail.com and check out our previous work at www.pennspark.org.

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and stay updated with us.

I wrote down a long list of things I’m hyped for this year, and being part of this amazing community is at the top of it – followed by the fact that I get to keep writing my newsletters :) Stay whimsical. Get your flu shots. Until the next edition!

With love,

Meiling Mathur

Co-President, Penn Spark 💌

item.title: Five days and counting
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Where did this semester even go? April showers bring lots of flowers on Locust…and Spark showcase!

🎉 YOU’RE INVITED – SHOWCASE!

Sunday, April 27th @ 5pm

Wu and Chen Auditorium in Levine Hall

After a semester of hard work, we are excited to present all of our projects at showcase! Come check out what our teams have been building:

  • Franklin Benchmark: Mini-game platform for Penn students to rank themselves in everyday activities, such as arithmetic, reaction times, and button mashing.

  • Deerly: A platform for users to send each other uplifting "open when" letters tied to specific prompts using text, voice, or photos.

  • Penne: A social dining app made just for Penn students to share food recommendations, real-time reviews, and thoughts on dining hall dishes.

  • Into the Blue: Our companion app to Penn Museum’s “Into the Blue” exhibit to guide visitors around the use of the color blue in artifacts throughout history.

  • Internet Atlas: An internet mapping project where we trace how users travel across websites, visualizing personal trends and larger emergent patterns in a coordinate map system that is user-defined.

  • Spark Roomies: An app that gamifies the roommates’ experience by awarding points to roommates who complete their cleaning tasks.

  • Penn Time Capsule: A gamified system of storing photos and videos using retro gaming-style memory systems to create a nostalgic and engaging way to relive and preserve special moments.

This is an excellent opportunity to learn more about what we do and connect with us if you’re interested in working with us next fall. Bring your friends – we look forward to seeing you there!

💼 2025 – 2026 Executive Board

We are excited to announce next year’s executive board:

  • Raphael Martinez and Meiling Mathur, Presidents

  • Estelle Kim, VP External

  • Ruth Zhao, VP Internal

  • Brandon Yan, VP Red

  • Nishat Olayiwola, VP Blue

Thank you to everyone on our current board for a great year, and we are looking forward to working with our new members this fall!

💕 Your turn

Interested in working with our team? Questions about what we do? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Email us all your thoughts at upennspark@gmail.com or find us on Instagram at @pennspark – we would love to hear from you!

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support our work.

Looks like this is my last newsletter as VP External. Thanks for a great year, everybody. Have a wonderful summer!

With love,

Meiling Mathur

VP External, Penn Spark 💌

item.title: A spring with Spark...is here
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
From Spring Break and Daylight Savings to St. Patrick’s Day weekend, this month has been going by fast. We hope everyone is taking care during these busy times, and we’re looking forward to closing out the month with some exciting updates.

🎤 YOU’RE INVITED – Naheel Jawaid @ Google Design Talk

Thursday, Mar 27 at 6:30pm in Wu and Chen Auditorium

Hosted by Penn Spark and Product Space @ Penn 

Penn Spark and Product Space @ Penn are excited to welcome Naheel Jawaid, a product designer at Google, to share the story of the biggest inflection point that took him from student stuck in a rut — to building a career working on the things that fulfill him most.

He'll also share a peek of what design looks like at a place like Google, with a light interactive group exercise.

Naheel has built 0-1 products at Google like AR Glasses & AI Creation Tools. He's worked with Google for Startups mentoring early stage startups, and also built a product which was acquired by Youtube within Google's Area 120 startup incubator. On the side he's helped start a Youtube channel around hip hop & runs a design accelerator aimed at creating the next gen of top 1% designers.

🎨 OPENING – Penn Spark and Penn Museum present “Into the Blue”

Exhibit opens Friday, Mar 28 at the Penn Museum

We are thrilled to share the upcoming launch of “Into the Blue”, a student exhibit that our team created in collaboration with the Penn Museum. We developed an app that encourages visitors to learn about the color blue and how it has been used throughout history by finding blue objects all across the Penn Museum, taking a photo, and saving that object to a digital stickerbook. The experience encourages close looking and learning across all the exhibits.

Tickets can be purchased to visit the Penn Museum website here.

📘 Blue projects

Franklin Benchmark

Franklin Benchmark is a platform exclusively for Penn students to rank themselves in everyday activities. It features mini-games to test their peak human form such as arithmetic, reaction times, and button masher. With real-time leaderboards, students can brag about their prestigious achievements to their parents and recruiters.

Deerly

Deerly is a digital platform where friends and kind strangers send you uplifting "open when" letters, tied to specific prompts, using text, voice, or photos. To unlock a personalized message at a key moment, you must first write one yourself—fueling a continuous cycle of giving and receiving support.

Penne

Penne is a social dining app made just for Penn students. Whether you're looking for food recommendations, checking out real-time reviews, tracking your meals, or sharing your thoughts on dining hall dishes, Penne helps you stay updated and eat better. Think Beli, but built for Penn—more interactive and designed for campus life.

🍎 Red projects

Internet Atlas

Now, more than ever, it is important to be conscious of spaces (digital or physical) that we inhibit. Internet Atlas is meant to instill awareness into time we spend on areas of the net and how that reflects something about us as people － what do we want our footprints to say about us? Internet Atlas is an internet mapping project where we trace how users travel across websites, visualizing personal trends and larger emergent patterns in a coordinate map system that is user-defined. In a more poetic imagining of the web, we hope to create an insightful and interactive experience of reflecting on the time we spend.

Spark Roomies

An app that gamifies the roommates experience! Keep your living spaces clean with your roomies by completing tasks, earning points, and creating a personalized living space.

Penn Time Capsule

Penn Time Capsule is a mobile app that reimagines how we store and capture our photos. Through an immersive 3D visual experience, we guide users to gamify their memories, using retro gaming-style memory systems to create a nostalgic and engaging way to relive and preserve special moments.

💕 Your turn

Interested in working with our team? Questions about what we do? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Email us all your thoughts at upennspark@gmail.com or find us on Instagram at @pennspark – we would love to hear from you!

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe for free to stay updated with us.

Be fabulous. Enjoy the warmer days ahead. Until the next edition!

With love,

Meiling Mathur

VP External, Penn Spark 💌

item.title: A short and sweet month
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Who else spent Valentine’s day downtown this year? While the Eagles were bringing home our victory, we’ve been cooking—or should I say, baking—some exciting events of our own on this side of the Schuylkill.

🧁 YOU’RE INVITED – BAKE SALE ON FRIDAY!

Friday, Feb 28, 12-2pm on Locust

Come find us on Locust this Friday, Feb 28 from 12-2pm! As Penn’s premier organization of developers, designers, and Michelin-rated bakers, we’ve got all the sweet treats for you to enjoy on your day off.

🎤 Speaker event: Ace Kim — Founder and CEO @ SphereUs

Sunday, Mar 2, 3-4pm in JMHH 365

Ace Kim is the founder and CEO of SphereUs, an AI-powered platform that transforms how brands manage ambassador campaigns by automating key processes—sourcing, onboarding, task management, and performance analytics. Leveraging real-time analytics from platforms like Instagram and TikTok, SphereUs provides brands with data-driven insights to optimize campaigns.

Since its founding, SphereUs has been generating revenue, won over $27,500 in non-dilutive grants, and secured $100,000 in pre-seed funding from angel investors. SphereUs was also featured in Poets & Quants' "Most Disruptive Undergraduate Startups of 2024" and completed Penn’s VIP-X accelerator program.

Listen to Ace discuss his experiences with entrepreneurship, product development, and venture capital at our speaker event this Sunday, Mar 2 at 3pm in Huntsman.

🥳 Welcome newbies!

Last but definitely not least, we are thrilled to welcome our seven new developers and three new designers to our team. We’ve enjoyed getting to know them through the application and onboarding process, and we can’t wait to build with them this semester.

💕 Your turn

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support our work.

Interested in working with our team? Questions about what we do? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Email us all your thoughts at upennspark@gmail.com or find us on Instagram at @pennspark – we would love to hear from you!

Stay united. Keep up the brotherly love, wherever in the world you are. Until the next edition!

With love,

Meiling Mathur

VP External, Penn Spark 💌

item.title: New Year's resolution: Join Penn Spark!
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Happy new semester! If joining Penn Spark wasn’t already on your 2025 bingo card, now’s the time to get started with your application. Keep reading to find out how you can be part of Penn’s premier tech and design club. Applications are due Jan 27th at 5pm – don’t miss it!

🍎 Application information

We are looking for Red designers and developers this semester. These roles are geared towards members who have prior experience designing and developing and want to get started with our projects this semester. Both designer and developer applications consist of a first-round written application with a technical assessment, followed by a second-round interview. 

🎉 Recruitment events

General Information Meeting slides: If you weren’t able to attend our information session last night, here is a copy of our slideshow with information about our team and application process.

Student Activities Council (SAC) fair: Come find us in Houston Hall on Saturday, Jan 25th from 12 to 3pm to speak with our members and answer any questions you may have!

Please feel free to email upennspark@gmail.com or DM us on Instagram at @pennspark with any questions.

💕Your Turn

Apply here by Jan 27th! Follow us on Instagram at @pennspark and fill out our interest form to stay updated with us.

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe for our latest updates.

Interested in working with our team? Questions about what we do? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Email us all your thoughts at upennspark@gmail.com or find us on Instagram at @pennspark – we would love to hear from you!

Time to lock in. Looking forward to reading those apps.

With love,

Meiling Mathur

VP External, Penn Spark 💌

item.title: It's beginning to look a lot like showcase season
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
It’s the 3rd of December; we don’t have polyester sweaters, but we do have some exciting news:

🎉 YOU’RE INVITED – SPARK SHOWCASE THIS SATURDAY!

Our End-of-Semester Showcase is here! Come to Gutmann MPR this Saturday, Dec 7 from 5 to 7pm to check out our work this semester. From building a 3D version of Reddit’s r/place and a donation portfolio to reimagining the ways users can explore Penn’s campus and Philadelphia beyond, we’ve got a lot to be excited about. Our Blue members will be pitching their projects for next semester based on what they learned from this semester’s bootcamp, including their tech stacks and designs.

Bring your friends and meet our team – this is a great opportunity to get to know us if you’re interested in joining us next semester. And speaking of joining us, keep an eye out for our applications for Red Developers and Designers next semester. Make sure to follow us on Instagram at @pennspark if you haven’t already to stay tuned for the latest updates. 

💕Your Turn

This newsletter’s pretty short. If you want to hear more from us, come to showcase! We’re even more fun in person, promise.

Interested in working with our team? Questions about what we do? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Email us all your thoughts at upennspark@gmail.com or find us on Instagram at @pennspark – we would love to hear from you!

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe to stay updated with us.

Stay cheery. Go crush those exams. Until next year!

With love,

Meiling Mathur

VP External, Penn Spark 💌

item.title: 60 degrees? In November?
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Mariah Carey’s started defrosting, and the season of gratitude is upon us. From leading a hardworking project team and working with our amazing exec board to having tons of fun with the most supportive club members I could ask for, Spark has given me a lot to be grateful for this year. Keep reading to find out what we’ve been cooking, just in time for Thanksgiving.

🎉 Alumni Homecoming Event – November 16th

Dear Spark Alumni: If you’re in town, you’re invited to our annual Homecoming Dinner this Saturday at 6:30pm! We will be catering dinner on-campus — exact location will be sent out tonight or tomorrow. We would love to welcome you back to campus for this event to learn how you’ve been doing, as well as provide everyone with the opportunity to reunite with old friends and meet our new members. Eat, mingle, and celebrate Homecoming with us!

📘 Blue Curriculum Updates!

Our wonderful Blue VP Raphael Martinez and student mentors have been providing our newbies with a comprehensive bootcamp on software development and design. This semester, Blue is guiding students through the creation of an extended project that they will build upon as they progress through our course, as well as pairing them with each other to create a buddy system for support and accountability. 

Our devs are currently learning HTML, CSS, and React, as well as learning Node and PostgreSQL. Our designers are learning about user research, user flows, wireframes, and lo-fi prototyping in Figma, and they are preparing to tackle UI design principles and user testing next. Both teams have started their final projects, which they will showcase at the end of this semester. We love to see it 👏

🍎 Red Projects

Our Red teams just delivered their midpoint presentations, and we couldn’t be more stoked to see the progress they’ve been making on their projects. Here’s a snapshot of what we have to look forward to at our end of semester showcase:

3D R/place

3D R/place is a collaborative digital art experiment that invites Penn students to create 3D art in a shared voxel grid. Inspired by Reddit’s r/place, our platform allows users to place colored voxels/blocks in a 3D space, building and shaping a dynamic digital canvas in real-time. The idea came about as a way to combine interactive 3D art with the social quirks of Penn's campus culture, letting students collectively shape a unique visual experience. At the end of the project, we’ll compile a timelapse showcasing the evolution of the art as the community builds it together.  We hope to celebrate campus culture in a digital, dynamic, and interactive 3D landscape. 

Philanthropia

Philanthropia is a startup looking to revolutionize giving. Users can create donation portfolios to spread their giving across multiple organizations and causes that they care about, instead of one or two. Philanthropia also provides information about each charity, allowing users to make informed decisions. This reduces inter-charity competition over donor acquisition and makes giving less stressful for users, leading to more impact. Penn Spark is collaborating with Philanthropia to build an onboarding flow that will walk new users through creating their first portfolio and understanding the platform, making it super easy to get started.

Penn Pin

Penn Pin is an interactive mobile application that motivates students to explore campus through real-time navigation, engaging content, and community-driven insights about their surroundings. Featuring an interactive graphic map, the app pinpoints users’ location and highlights nearby landmarks. Users can leave short comments and reactions ("pins") about various locations, whether it be the Ben Franklin Bench or DRL, and react to them by traveling near the landmark or viewing location-based ‘fun-fact’ popups and notifications. Designed to continually engage users while melding comfortably into their busy lifestyles, Penn Pin invites our school community to discover and share the stories that make campus home.

Stride

Spark is piloting a new initiative this year to increase our social impact on spaces outside of campus, ensuring that we use our talents and skills to give back to the Philadelphia community we are all a part of. Our social impact team is creating Stride, an app to improve the accessibility and ease of sustainable transportation use in Philadelphia. We are mapping the safest walking, biking, and Septa routes between destinations, as well as providing users with stats on their environmental impact. Our platform encourages them to connect (read: playfully compete) with friends to collectively maximize their use of sustainable transportation. We are excited to partner with the Delaware Valley Regional Planning Commision and Clean Air Council in Philadelphia for market research and user testing as part of our community collaborations.

Come to our end-of-semester showcase on December 7 in Gutmann MPR if you want to be the first to try out our projects!

Drop your email here to stay updated on our upcoming showcase👇

💕Your Turn

Tell us what you’re thankful for!

Leave a comment

Interested in working with our team? Questions about what we do? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Email us all your thoughts at upennspark@gmail.com or find us on Instagram at @pennspark – we would love to hear from you!

Stay warm. Take care of yourselves. Until the next edition!

With love,

Meiling Mathur

VP External, Penn Spark 💌

item.title: Brat Summer is out, Spark Fall is in
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Happy autumn! Coding in coffee shops and drawing wireframes in cozy sweaters is back this season, along with Penn Spark’s newsletter. 

For our newest subscribers, we are a group of students at the University of Pennsylvania who bridge tech and design to build creative, community, and client projects. When we aren’t busy working on the next greatest startup ideas together, you can usually find our members in every corner of campus working on amazing projects of all kinds. We dream big, play hard, and eat a lot of hotpot together. 

🔥 YOU’RE INVITED! Spark x Labs x Hack Halloween Mixer – Friday, November 1st

Get ready for a spooky night out at the Cyberpunk Cemetery with Penn Spark, Penn Labs, and Hack4Impact! Come socialize with developers and designers across Penn’s software community. We may not be able to get you an internship for next summer, but we can throw a Halloween party that is (nearly) as scary as a technical interview.

Tickets can be purchased here: https://partiful.com/e/EnPd65kzgRfwzb1XuhFM. 

Price is $15 online and $20 at the door. Sales close at 5pm the day of. 

The event will be at 10pm at TLO with a joint pregame starting at 9pm at Evo. Put on your scariest tech recruiter outfits, and bring your most cursed HackerRank questions – we can’t wait to see you there!

💫 Onboarding recap

We had a wonderful time last month onboarding our new members! We could not be more proud to welcome our 10 new designers and 14 new developers to our team, with 14 new members joining our Blue educational boot camp and 10 joining our Red project teams.

💕 Your Turn

Interested in working with our team? Questions about what we do? Want to grab coffee with me? 👀 Email us all your thoughts at upennspark@gmail.com or find us on Instagram at @pennspark – we would love to hear from you!

Stay warm. Be happy. Until the next edition!

With love,

Meiling Mathur

VP External, Penn Spark 💌

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support our work.

item.title: Guess who's back, back again
item.description: Did you miss us? Not as much as we missed you!💙 Welcome to the first newsletter of the year!
item.content:encoded:
Hi Sparkies <3

Hope you had a relaxing winter break, whether it was spent on Leetcode grinding for an internship, travelling the world, or spending the holidays with your family! Welcome back!

If you’re new to Spark, let us introduce ourselves. We’re a community of students at the University of Pennsylvania that bridge tech and design to build both creative and client projects from ground-up. ⚡️Pretty cool right?

We decided to start this monthly newsletter to let you know what we’ve been up to, what’s going on in the tech & design world, and bring some upcoming events and opportunities (& even job opportunities 👀) along the way! We’re so excited you’re here with us on this new journey!

💙 Penn Spark

Spark Updates ⚡️

What have we been up to this semester?

Apps just dropped!

Happy first week of classes and welcome to our mailing list! We’re excited to announce that our Red applications are now live and due on Wednesday, January 18th, 11:59pm EST! Find more details about each of the roles below. You can apply to as many roles as you see fit. 

Spark Red
Spark Red designers and developers work in teams to build more advanced projects, either through working with real-world clients and nonprofits or on creatively brainstormed ideas. Returning members or new members with proficient technical experience can join. (Developers: CIS 120 or equivalent, knowledge of full-stack development. Designers: Knowledge of Figma for mockups and prototyping) Spark Red applicants must complete both this written application and the technical assessment in order to be considered. Interested? Apply here!

For more information about joining, check out our website here. Remember: applications are due Wednesday, January 18th, 11:59pm EST! If selected, we will reach out for an interview between January 23rd and 25th after reviewing your application. We'll also be having a General Interest Meeting on January 15th, where we'll describe what we do in more detail as well as answer any Q&A. As always, if you have any questions or comments, please feel free to email us! We look forward to seeing your application!

We want to hear from you!

Our goal is to make our newsletter as informative and impactful as possible, so we want to hear from you! How can we improve our newsletter? What do you want to see in our newsletter? Let us know!

Job Board 🤓

Tech and design summer internships tailored to college students like you <3

Tech 💻

Discord’s Nitro Expression team is looking for a Product Engineering Intern→ in San Francisco, CA for the summer. The Nitro Expression team is building fun, creative, and premium ways for users to express themselves while talking and hanging out on Discord. Their aim is for these products to empower our users to express themselves authentically through emoji, stickers, and other creative media ecosystems that exist on our platform.
Qualcomm is looking for a Software Engineering Intern→ in Austin, TX. As a Qualcomm Software Engineering Intern, you’ll have the opportunity to push the boundaries of what exists and help establish the new standards for tomorrow. Interns will have the opportunity to explore one or more tracks: embedded software, system integration & test, ML/AI, firmware/wireless, automotive, application development.
Motorola Solutions’s Service Design Tools & Infrastructure team is looking for a Data Science intern→ in Schaumburg, IL adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for tools suite and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Motorola Solutions is a global leader in public safety and enterprise security.

Design 🖋

Workday is a provider of cloud-based software that specializes in applications for financial management, enterprise resource planning (ERP) and human capital management (HCM). They are looking for a Product Design Intern→ to join their Experience Design and Development Group (EDDG) in Boulder, CO.
Mercury offers banking* for startups — at any size or stage. Launched in 2019, Mercury is trusted by more than 100,000 startups. They are looking for a Product Design Intern→ to join their Experience Design and Development Group (EDDG) in San Francisco, CA.
Landor & Fitch is a brand consulting firm founded in 1941 by Walter Landor, who pioneered some research, design, and consulting methods that the branding industry still uses. At Landor & Fitch, students are connected with the most creative people in the world to build brands like Apple, Coca-Cola, Lego and Nike, to name a few. They're hiring a Design Intern→ in Cincinnati, OH.

Thanks for reading Penn Spark Newsletter! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support our work.

item.title: Happy Last Day of Classes!
item.description: Can you believe it? Even if you skipped classes today (guilty), go out and celebrate!
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Hi Sparkies <3

Happy final day of classes! While the grind never stops, we hope that you’ll be able to relax before finals season and showcase. You’ve worked so hard this semester and deserve a break! Go grab some boba or treat yourself to a nice dinner!

For this 5th and final edition for this semester (don’t worry, we’ll be back in the fall!), we’ll be dropping the latest tech & design news, bringing more events, and personally inviting you to our showcase event this Friday!

💙 Penn Spark

You’re Invited! ⚡️

This Friday: Our Spring 2022 Project Showcase!

Come check out the projects we've been working on this past semester! From working directly with clients to building apps for the Penn community, our members have come together to work on a variety of technical and/or design projects. Our showcase will be Friday, April 29th from 4:30-6PM at the Harnwell Rooftop Lounge! Snacks will be provided!

Interested in attending? Head over to our Facebook page to learn more, RSVP, and share with your friends!

Tech & Design Updates 💡

The latest tech and design news that might ~spark~ your imagination and interest

Tech 💻

The Tech Bubble that Never Burst
For a decade, warnings about a tech bubble have only led to more money flooding into high-growth start-ups. Could this one be it?
Musk’s Plan to Reveal the Twitter Algorithm Won’t Solve Anything
When Elon Musk victory-tweeted his $44 billion acquisition of Twitter on Monday evening, he committed to improving the social network by, among other things, “making the algorithms open source to increase trust.”
A guide teaching programmers “to live longer” goes viral on GitHub among Chinese tech workers
A Chinese-language guide on GitHub entitled “HowToLiveLonger” is trending within the Chinese tech community. Despite its serious and scientific tone, the new “guide” appears to be a pointed joke, taking aim at ongoing overwork practices in China’s tech industry and their impact on employees’ mental and physical well-being.

Design 🖋

Yamaha Design Laboratory Recreates Toy Pianos as Traditional Japanese Furniture
What if the piano evolved independently in Japan? Yamaha Design Laboratory asked itself this question at the start of its latest project, a set of three furniture-style pianos developed in collaboration with the Department of Design at Chiba University.
This language app’s branding hopes to “open up a world of possibilities”
London-based brand consultancy Fellow has created the branding for language app Kleo, which uses a portal visual to transport users to different countries.
Wrigley’s Extra chewing gum drops “dental hygiene” codes in global rebrand
Wrigley’s Extra chewing gum has rebranded to move away from dental hygiene cues and instead focus on its variety of flavours.

Upcoming Events 📆

Upcoming hackathons, creative jams, conferences, and more to add to your calendar

Tech 💻

DragonHacks 2022, April 30 - May 1
DragonHacks is Drexel University's 24-hour hackathon which will be hosted by Drexel University IEEE in Spring 2022.
RU Hacks 2022, May 6 - 8
RU Hacks is Ryerson University’s student-run hackathon, an event open to anyone around the globe! Register for stellar workshops, events and mentorship opportunities, all hosted by a variety of incredible and diverse individuals.
Out for Undergrad: Engineering Conference, Sept. 16 - 18
Out for Undergrad invites high-achieving,LGBTQ+ undergraduates to four industry-specific programs (Tech, Engineering, Marketing, and Business), where they learn to navigate the nuances of a diverse corporate climate. In providing them with these resources, we help connect them with top companies, transform their professional skills, and kickstart their careers.

Design 🖋

CONFIG Figma Design Conference, May 10-11
Config is Figma’s annual conference where users come together to learn from each other. This year, it’ll take place virtually over a 24 hour period.
Innovation in UX/UI Design Conference 2022, May 13
Ideate Labs is hosting a design conference to discuss freelance, entrepreneurship, UX research, pivoting in UX, UI, diversity and inclusion
Virtua11y, May 17-19
Virtua11y brings the leading thinkers and doers in accessibility and digital inclusion to share best practice, the latest thinking and what the future holds for accessibility. Expect talks, panel discussions, workshops and interviews that you can enjoy for free.

Job Board 🤓

Tech and design positions tailored to college students like you <3

Tech 💻

Endless Frontier Fellowship 🌄 is a one-year experience in Washington, D.C. where Fellows→ work at the forefront of science, technology, and innovation as policy entrepreneurs embedded at either the Institute for Progress, the Federation of American Scientists, or the Lincoln Network.
NYC Mayor's Office for Economic Opportunity 🚕 works to improve the systems of government by advancing the use of research, data, and design in program and policy development, service delivery, and budget decisions. They're hiring a Product Management Fellow→ for a paid, six-month position in New York, NY

Design 🖋

Benefits Data Trust 📊 improves health and financial security by harnessing the power of data, technology, and policy to provide dignified and equitable access to assistance. They're hiring a remote or Philadelphia, PA-based UX Research Intern→ who will help uncover user needs through research and collaboration with stakeholders.
The Trevor Project 🌈 is the world’s largest suicide prevention and crisis intervention organization for LGBTQ young people. They're looking for a remote Graphic Designer→ to produce digital, social, print, and other assets that attract, inform, and galvanize Trevor’s stakeholders.

item.title: It's the final countdown!
item.description: Can you believe we have less than 2 weeks of classes left? Till then, we wish you the best and hope you end the semester with a bang!
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Hi Sparkies <3

Wow, we can’t believe how fast this semester has passed! As we start preparing for our final showcase (Save the date, it’s in 2 weeks!), we’ve been able to reflect on how much we’ve grown as designers and developers and cannot wait to share what we’ve been up to!

Now on our 4th newsletter edition, we’re so excited to see how much our community has grown and can’t wait to continue giving the latest tech and design news, opportunities, and events.

💙 Penn Spark

Spark Updates ⚡️

What have we been up to this semester?

This Saturday: Spark Design Panel!

We are hosting a virtual design panel this Saturday, 4/16 at 4PM on Zoom! The panel will feature three designers who will discuss their design journeys and work, provide advice for pursuing design, and answer any questions at the end.

Interested in attending? Head over to our Facebook page to learn more, RSVP, and share with your friends!

Tech & Design Updates 💡

The latest tech and design news that might ~spark~ your imagination and interest

Tech 💻

Toronto, the Quietly Booming Tech Town
For all the excitement around places like Austin and Miami, the biggest tech expansion has been in Canada’s largest city.
Spotify, the latest tech giant to support NFTs?
Spotify is planning to add non-fungible tokens (NFTs) and blockchain tech. It has planned its streaming service to add the NFT tech and wants to boost the earnings of its artists.
Anonymous: How hackers are trying to undermine Putin
The Anonymous hacktivist collective has been bombarding Russia with cyber-attacks since declaring "cyber war" on President Vladimir Putin in retaliation for the invasion of Ukraine.

Design 🖋

The US Government Needs to Invest in Digital Design
Our nation’s failure to invest in information technology has severely limited our Covid response. A federal chief experience officer could change that.
A Quick Guide to UX Metrics
UX metrics are the indicators that show whether your product design strategy is working or not. They also allow you to track design changes over time and see how your product performs in dynamics.
The UX Implication of a Voting System
At the time of excessive digitalization, the old-fashioned voting systems with small papers are a plebiscite for the conservation of low tech.

Upcoming Events 📆

Upcoming hackathons, creative jams, conferences, and more to add to your calendar

Tech 💻

Creatica 2022, April 29 - May 1
New York City’s virtual, gender-focused hackathon. Creatica welcomes all in high school and college but is centered around supporting women and non-binary individuals in tech.
DragonHacks 2022, April 30 - May 1
DragonHacks is Drexel University's 24-hour hackathon which will be hosted by Drexel University IEEE in Spring 2022.
RU Hacks 2022, May 6 - 8
RU Hacks is Ryerson University’s student-run hackathon, an event open to anyone around the globe! Register for stellar workshops, events and mentorship opportunities, all hosted by a variety of incredible and diverse individuals.

Design 🖋

CONFIG Figma Design Conference, May 10-11
Config is Figma’s annual conference where users come together to learn from each other. This year, it’ll take place virtually over a 24 hour period.
Innovation in UX/UI Design Conference 2022, May 13
Ideate Labs is hosting a design conference to discuss freelance, entrepreneurship, UX research, pivoting in UX, UI, diversity and inclusion
Virtua11y, May 17-19
Virtua11y brings the leading thinkers and doers in accessibility and digital inclusion to share best practice, the latest thinking and what the future holds for accessibility. Expect talks, panel discussions, workshops and interviews that you can enjoy for free.

Job Board 🤓

Tech and design positions tailored to college students like you <3

Tech 💻

Nuna is making high-quality healthcare affordable and accessible for everyone by partnering with healthcare payers, including government agencies and health plans, to turn data into learnings and information into meaning. They're searching for a Software Engineering Intern→ in San Francisco, CA. 
Open Learning Exchange is moving from education to learning to enable power, meaning and connection for children, youth, and their communities. They seek a dedicated, passionate Remote Software Engineering Intern→ for an Angular project.
The Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia is one of the 12 regional Reserve Banks that, together with the Board of Governors in Washington, D.C., make up the Federal Reserve System. They’re searching for a Summer Information Technology Services Intern→ to provide program support for their new Web Services function.

Design 🖋

ActBlue is a nonprofit that builds tech and infrastructure for Democratic campaigns, progressive-aligned causes, and people trying to make an impact in order to fuel long-term, people-powered change. Their team is looking for a remote Product Design Intern→ to join their team this summer.
Vera Institute of Justice is a nonprofit criminal justice organization that strives to build just government institutions and safe communities free from the scourge of racism, white supremacy, profit, and inequity that is pervasive in this country’s legal systems. They're searching for a remote Design Intern→ who will work as part of their communications team.
Tech Talent Project aims to increase the ability of the U.S. government to recruit modern technical leaders in order to achieve critical economic, policy, and human outcomes. Their team is seeking a Project Management Intern→ to join their remote team this summer.

item.title: Spring has sprung (but why is it so cold)
item.description: A week into spring, we hope your semester is blossoming!
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Hey Sakura Sparkies <3

Is it really spring if you still see Canada Goose coats on campus? Anyways, happy spring sparkies! Whether you’re finishing up midterms or gearing up for Spring Fling, it’s a great time to reflect, appreciate your growth, and strive towards new goals!

For this edition, we’ll spotlight some Spark Blue projects, delve into the world of NFTs, and as always, help you find an internship for your blooming career.

💙 Penn Spark

Spark Updates ⚡️

What have we been up to this semester?

Congrats (Bootcamp) Grads! 🎓

Our Spark Blue designers and developers have completed their 6 weeks of bootcamp and are now going into ~project mode~! Here are some deliverables we wanted to spotlight 🔦:

  • Alyssa’s Personal Website

  • Myka’s Mobile App Design Process

  • Yanjie’s React App

Organization Spotlight: MockingJ 🐦

This semester, our red designers and developers will be working on 3 client projects, and our second project spotlight is on MockingJ!

MockingJ is a smart interview prep platform designed to help students and professionals prepare for “that interview” to get their dream job by providing support to users while creating a safe, accessible, and exploratory environment for preparing for their job applications and their next big interviews.

Shoutout to Subin, Claire, James, and Acelyn for taking on this project! We can’t wait to see the finished app at showcase! 💙

Tech & Design Updates 💡

The latest tech and design news that might ~spark~ your imagination and interest

Tech 💻

What Is An NFT? Everything You Need To Know About The Future Of Art
It seems that everyday the crypto world of NFTs is making a new spectacular headline.
Can NFT Technology Expand Beyond Digital Apes and Punks?
The bubble will likely burst at some point, though, so the question is: what else can NFTs do? Do they have legitimate use cases beyond digital collectibles and art investment?
Berlin-based startup fuels no-code NFT platform for creators with €1.5 million
FUEL enables creators to build their own custom-branded NFT shop without any technical knowledge required.

Design 🖋

Takashi Murakami’s NFT art is the best thing we’ve seen this year
Is this the best NFT pixel art yet?
A graphic designer who focused on agency commissions switched to creating NFT art in 2022
Amy Kilner had been a graphic designer for 10 years, creating designs for events and other projects, when the pandemic struck in 2020. 
Ukraine Has Launched an NFT ‘Museum’ to Preserve the Country’s History
Ukraine will launch an NFT museum “to preserve the statehood and history of Ukraine,” Alex Bornyakov, the country’s Deputy Minister of Digital Transformation, said.

Upcoming Events 📆

Upcoming hackathons, creative jams, conferences, and more to add to your calendar

Tech 💻

Philly Codefest 2022, April 4
Philly Codefest is a free software and hardware hackathon that encourages students and professionals from all experience levels and backgrounds to work together to develop innovative solutions to help solve real world challenges.
YHack, April 8-10
YHack is Yale’s largest annual student-run hackathon. This year, the hackathon will be hybrid and hackers will be taken around the world to tackle global issues and explore diverse perspectives using technology.
Boston Regional Datathon, April 9th
Datathons are data science competitions that challenge students from the world's best universities to tackle real-world social challenges in topics such as urban traffic, renewable energy, and education. This will be the first in-person event Correlation One will be hosting since the start of the pandemic!

Design 🖋

Penn Engineers Without Borders Design Challenge
This design challenge aims to support Penn undergraduate student teams in developing and launching an innovative product solution for humanitarian issue pertaining to the Philadelphia community throughout the 2022 school year.
College + Hulu Creative Jam, April 7th
Showcase your talent in front of the global student community. Meet the Hulu creative team and learn about the challenge, then submit your video for a chance to win!
AIGA Design Conference, October 20–22
The AIGA Design Conference is your opportunity to participate in fresh ideation for design from leaders in the field.

Job Board 🤓

Tech and design positions tailored to college students like you <3

Tech 💻

A Penn startup, Ripple Interactive, is recruiting engineers for their 2022 Software Engineer Intern program. Ripple Interactive is a VC-backed tech startup building a social discovery app that uses breakthrough technology to allow people to discover, interact, and chat with users in bluetooth range. 
Ancestry is looking for a Data Services Software Engineer Intern to join our Darwin team this summer. The Darwin team builds a modern, scalable user behavior data and business events system. As a Data Services intern on the Darwin team, you will help build Java back-end systems on advanced Amazon AWS cloud infrastructure to help support millions of Ancestry customers.
Chegg is looking for a Security Engineering Intern to contribute to their security program. The candidate will be responsible for reproducing security vulnerabilities discovered internally and reported to us by customers and researchers, helping identify the root cause of security vulnerabilities in our codebase, and assisting in carrying out incident response duties.

Design 🖋

The L.A. Times Innovation Lab calls for ambitious students from design, engineering, journalism, and research backgrounds to join our 4th cohort of Creative Technologist Internship. Since the conception of the program, we have strived to build a pipeline of STEM college students into the journalism industry while producing future-thinking processes and products.
Uber is looking for current students to join them this summer as a Design UX Research Intern for 12 weeks beginning Summer 2022. Your work will focus on improving accessibility and inclusion of Uber products like the Driver app, UberEats and our other emerging products.
Comcast is looking for a remote UX Design Intern to work with other UX personnel to deliver product-specific personas, interactivity designs, and UI layouts/elements to deliver on the vision of the product and the goals of its users.

item.title: Sooo about spring break...
item.description: From San Juan to San Francisco, we hope you had a restful and relaxing spring break! 😌
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Hey Spring Breaker Sparkies <3

We hope you had a fantastic spring break, whether you went to Puerto Rico or Florida like 80% of the Penn student body 👀 or hibernated at home!

For this edition, we hope to ~ease~ you back into your work and welcome you back to campus! Whether you're looking to kick off spring with a new opportunity, still looking for the perfect summer internship, or just want to know what's happening in tech and design, keep reading!

💙 Penn Spark

Spark Updates ⚡️

What have we been up to this semester?

To-Do: Make a To-Do List 📝

Our Spark Blue developers got to apply their React skills to create to-do list web apps! From a mango-themed app (iykyk) to a super sleek solution, we’re super excited to brag about what our new developers have accomplished in 3 weeks! 🤩

Organization Spotlight: ARTZ Philly 🎨

This semester, our red designers and developers will be working on 3 client projects, and our first project spotlight is on ARTZ Philly!

ARTZ Philly has a program called ARTZ in the Neighborhood, which provides programming to folks living with dementia in the Hunting Park and Northwest Philly neighborhoods, responding to the different ways that folks in these under-served and under-resourced communities live with dementia. To allow for participants to more easily interact with ARTZ Philly virtually, our developers and designers are working on a mobile app that simplifies the process of connecting to online programming and collects all ARTZ in the Neighborhood information in one place.

Shoutout to Anna, Joyce, Matthew, and Eric for taking on this project! We can’t wait to see the finished app at showcase! 💙

Tech & Design Updates 💡

The latest tech and design news that might ~spark~ your imagination and interest

Tech 💻

How Much Real Money Can You Make From Virtual Art?
NFTs are making some collectors and artists rich, but success in this high-risk marketplace is more art than science.
How to Use Tech to Say Thank You
From recordings to custom visuals, here are some future-forward ways to show you appreciate someone.
These programming languages were most in-demand in 2021
Coding Dojo has released its annual review of the programming language skills most sought after from employers.

Design 🖋

The delightful history of fruit stickers, the world’s tiniest canvases for graphic design
A new exhibition celebrates the grocery-store gems, which have been around for almost a century.
Become a Case study Detective 🕵️‍♂️
A guide to effectively read case studies and hack your skill growth
How to Boost Inventiveness and Creativity With Pantone’s Very Peri
Pantone’s Color of the Year 2022 captures the zeitgeist of our time and opens our minds to the future

Upcoming Events 📆

Upcoming hackathons, creative jams, conferences, and more to add to your calendar

Tech 💻

HackCWRU, March 18th
HackCWRU is Case Western Reserve University’s annual hackathon.
Philly Codefest 2022, April 4
Philly Codefest is a free software and hardware hackathon that encourages students and professionals from all experience levels and backgrounds to work together to develop innovative solutions to help solve real world challenges.
Boston Regional Datathon, April 9th
Datathons are data science competitions that challenge students from the world's best universities to tackle real-world social challenges in topics such as urban traffic, renewable energy, and education. This will be the first in-person event Correlation One will be hosting since the start of the pandemic!

Design 🖋

Catalyst 2022, March 25
Catalyst is Boston University FORGE Design Studios' annual designathon. During this UX-focused competition, undergraduate students from across the US collaborate in teams of 2-3 to address a real-world design challenge.
College + Hulu Creative Jam, April 7th
Showcase your talent in front of the global student community. Meet the Hulu creative team and learn about the challenge, then submit your video for a chance to win!
AIGA Design Conference, October 20–22
The AIGA Design Conference is your opportunity to participate in fresh ideation for design from leaders in the field.

Job Board 🤓

Tech and design positions tailored to college students like you <3

Tech 💻

League of Conservation Voters believes our earth is worth fighting for because everyone has a right to clean air, water, and a safe, healthy community. They're hiring a remote Data and Evaluation Intern→ to support their civic engagement work. 
Littera is the first software platform designed to help K-12 schools and districts design, deliver, and monitor their tutoring programs. Their team is hiring a remote Backend Junior Software Engineer→ to work on their core backend APIs that govern student, tutor, and tutoring session data.
Connecticut Data Collaborative 📊 strives for informed decision-making across Connecticut and empowers an ecosystem of data users by democratizing access to public data and building data literacy. They're hiring a Civic Tech Developer→ to work in Hartford, CT or remotely.

Design 🖋

Community Solutions works to achieve a lasting end to homelessness that leaves no one behind. Their team is creating a first-of-its-kind social impact housing model called the North Hartford Community Land Trust and is searching for a Graphic Design & Data Visualization Intern→ to help tell its story in Hartford, CT.
Constructive is a leading social impact strategy and design firm that helps advance social, environmental, and economic justice. Their team is looking for a remote UX Design Apprentice→ to be part of their Apprenticeship Program that prioritizes career advancement for women, people of color, LGBTQIA+ individuals, and people with disabilities.
Wellinks is on a mission to help those with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) live fully and breathe freely. They're hiring a User Research Intern→ to be part of a service design team working on virtual health care services in New Haven, CT or remotely.

item.title: 3... 2... 1... NOW.
item.description: Welcome to Spark's FIRST EVER NEWSLETTER DROP! 2022 has been a busy year so far and we’re excited to share our latest updates with you in our new newsletter!
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:
Hi Sparkies <3

Just to reintroduce ourselves (because we’ve been through a LOT since our club was founded), hello! 👋 We’re a community of students at the University of Pennsylvania that bridge tech and design to build both creative and client projects from ground-up. ⚡️Pretty cool right?

We decided to start this bimonthly newsletter to let you know what we’ve been up to, what’s going on in the tech & design world, and bring some upcoming events and opportunities (& job opportunities 👀) along the way! We’re so excited you’re here with us on this new journey!

💙 Penn Spark

Spark Updates ⚡️

What have we been up to this semester?

Welcome, Newbies!

A belated (oops) welcome to our newbie class of 15 new members! We were so excited to welcome 11 new designers and developers who will be joining us at bootcamp in our Blue branch and 4 new designers and developers who will be working on client and creative projects in our Red branch! If you’re reading this, make sure to do your coffee chats 😉

Retreat

At the end of February, we had our first retreat as a club! We played games, got to relax and chill, and told some interesting stories (quite the bonding experience) 👀

Tech & Design Updates 💡

The latest tech and design news that might ~spark~ your imagination and interest

Tech 💻

Go read this report about how researchers used Google Maps to track the invasion of Ukraine
Dr. Jeffrey Lewis noticed a “traffic jam” on the border of Ukraine just before the invasion
GitHub Codespaces Can Now Be Templated to Improve Performance
GitHub has introduced prebuilt Codespaces to reduce the time it takes to spin up a full development environment for large, complex projects.
VSCode Extensions that every developer should use
Install these and thank me later 😉

Design 🖋

Carnegie Hall Refreshes ‘Timeline of African American Music’ Through a New Design By Synoptic Office
Synoptic Office, a design consultancy founded by Caspar Lam and YuJune Park, recently worked with Carnegie Hall to refresh the Timeline of African American Music.
Type Tuesday: In Search For Typographic Solutions
OGV Design Studio is an art and design practice focused on visual communication and strategic design founded by Serbian graphic designer Ognjen Gligorijevic.
When Architects Made Worlds
MoMA explores an era of sweeping change, when South Asian architects — pioneering women, among them — redefined the postcolonial era and helped construct new nation states.

Upcoming Events 📆

Upcoming hackathons, creative jams, conferences, and more to add to your calendar

Tech 💻

HackOWasp4.0, March 11th
HackOWASP is an annual national hackathon organized by the members of the OWASP Student Chapter, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala.
HackCWRU, March 18th
HackCWRU is Case Western Reserve University’s annual hackathon.
Boston Regional Datathon, April 9th
Datathons are data science competitions that challenge students from the world's best universities to tackle real-world social challenges in topics such as urban traffic, renewable energy, and education. This will be the first in-person event Correlation One will be hosting since the start of the pandemic!

Design 🖋

College + The Futur Creative Jam, March 8th
Want to sell an idea, side hustle, or product concept? Learn how to pitch like a pro! Join The Futur and hundreds of college students around the globe for an opportunity to showcase your talent and win a competition that will advance your career.
College + Hulu Creative Jam, April 7th
Showcase your talent in front of the global student community. Meet the Hulu creative team and learn about the challenge, then submit your video for a chance to win!
AIGA Design Conference, October 20–22
The AIGA Design Conference is your opportunity to participate in fresh ideation for design from leaders in the field.

Job Board 🤓

Tech and design positions tailored to college students like you <3

Tech 💻

Arc XP is a cloud-based digital experience platform that helps enterprise companies, retail brands and media and entertainment organizations create and distribute content, drive digital commerce, and deliver powerful multichannel experiences. They're hiring a Software Engineering Intern to join their remote team this summer.
OSIsoft is the force behind the PI System, the leading operations data management platform in essential sectors, such as power generation and utilities, water, oil and gas, mining, metals, manufacturing, pharmaceutical, facilities, transportation, food and beverage, and more. They’re now accepting applications for Software Development Interns for Summer 2022.
Johnson & Johnson is the world’s largest healthcare company. Join them this summer innovate to create new digital solutions and unlock the power of data and insights. They’re looking for students to join their Technology Internship program this summer.

Design 🖋

RStudio is a Public Benefit Corporation that creates software to help people understand data and make better decisions. They're hiring a UX/UI Design Intern to join their remote team this summer.
EL Education is a national nonprofit partnering with K-12 educators to transform public schools and districts into hubs of opportunity for all students to achieve excellent equitable outcomes. They're in need of a remote Graphic Designer who will work with their team on a part-time basis. 
WP Creative Group is the in-house creative agency for advertising at The Washington Post. We create award-winning advertisements that deliver business outcomes for today’s most notable brands by connecting our unique storytelling with innovative tech solutions. They’re hiring an Advertising Intern for the summer.

item.title: Coming soon!
item.description: This is the Penn Spark Newsletter, a newsletter with updates from Penn's Fav Tech & Design Club <3
item.dc:creator: Penn Spark
item.content:encoded:

Subscribe for club updates, announcements, tech & design articles, job opportunities, and more!
